title: Replays
body: Hey, I asked this about a day ago on the patch 6.22 board, but am yet to have an answer. I'd like to get this answered as quickly as possible because the match history where you can download replays is only 20 games. I am on the new alpha client by the way. Anyways, downloading and watching a match works directly from the league client, but when I go to the folder that the replay .rofl files are located in, I cannot open them. I tried downloading Firefox 3.36 which is supposedly compatible with html5, but I just get blank tabs when I try to open my replays. Thanks.

replies.body: i think if you record them in the replay system it creates a file you can view out side of the game client.
So there is no way to go to games 20+ games back and download them?

That's... kinda stupid. So I have to go and record anything I want from games less than 20 games back. Man here I thought I could download the replays and access them later... I mean there has to be a way to play the .rofl you get from downloading the replays.

You can only view *highlights* on a web browser, not an entire game. You can create a highlight by downloading and launching into a replay, then recording a segment that will be turned into a *highlight* that you can later access in the same folder as your replays and view them online. 

I hope this clears up the confusion.

Ah ok, I think I understand better now. Although I have a few clarification questions if you don't mind. Firstly, is there any way to access matches outside of your last 20 games (in terms of if you didn't download/make the highlights while it was in your match history)? I assume not, but I figured I might ask. Also, it might just be me misunderstanding how the system works, but in match history the button to access replays first downloads a .rofl file, and then you can watch the replay. I am just wondering what that initial .rofl file is for? Thanks.

I'm not aware of a way to access a match outside the last 20 in your match history. The .rofl file is the replay saved in a format that the Leauge client can play back.

I hope that clears up your questions.
But how do you play a replay that you've saved previously that is no longer in your 20 match history?  I have no way of opening it now.

As I mentioned above, I'm not aware of any way to do so. The current replay system limits playback to whatever is listed in your match history. I'm not on the team that developed this feature, so I don't know if there are any plans to update or change the replay system.

Let me know if you have any other questions.
